intro: Dimacria andrewsii, commonly known as the Andrews' dimacria, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Dimacria andrewsii is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
